title: Two Pauls Rudd Do Vicious, Poreless Battle in the Living With Yourself Trailer
text:
What happens when you take Black Mirror, sprinkle in some Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, and generously mix in two Pauls Rudd? Well, you get the upcoming Netflix series Living With Yourself, in which Rudd plays a struggling man named Miles who “undergoes a novel spa treatment that promises to make him a better person,” only to discover that he’s been “replaced by a new and improved version of himself.” The eight-episode series, which is told through multiple perspectives, was created by Daily Show alum Tim Greenberg and was previously in development at IFC. Aisling Bea, whose Hulu comedy series This Way Up recently debuted, also stars. Check out the very strange trailer above, then catch the rest when the show makes its way to Netflix on Friday, October 18.

Related
description: Netflix released the first trailer for “Living With Yourself,” a new series from “Daily Show” alum Tim Greenberg where Paul Rudd plays two versions of the same man.
